C o m m e n t:
Leptusa venusta
is by far the most widespread and most common species of the genus in the Caucasus region. For additional recent records see ASSING (2011) . Based on revised records, the distribution extends from the northwestern tip of the Greater Caucasus in the northwest and the Turkish province Trabzon eastwards to East Georgia and southeastwards to North Armenia ( Map 4 ). The species was recorded also from Daghestan (without specified locality) by PACE (1989) . It is not listed for Armenia in SCHÜLKE & SMETANA (2015), although it was reported from there (without specified locality) by SCHEERPELTZ (1966) .
